name: High Fidelity Quiz for Experts |    Movies

questions.text: Who leaves Rob at the start of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Laura.

	Laura is brilliantly played by Iben Hjejle. This is her first Hollywood film, but has previously played in various foreign films.

questions.text: What song does Barry play when he comes into work on Monday, prompting Rob to jump over the counter, fall over and then turn the song off?
questions.correct: Katrina and the Waves, "Walking On Sunshine"
options: Def Leppard, "Rock! Rock! Til You Drop!"
Cyndi Lauper, "Girls Just Want to Have Fun"
questions.explanation:
Katrina and the Waves, "Walking On Sunshine".

	This is where Barry does that funny dance! Very funny! Barry is well played by Jack Black, who has some of the funniest lines in the movies, such as, "I never thought I'd say this, but can I go work now?"

questions.text: What is the name of Rob's record store?
questions.explanation:
Championship Vinyl.

	And he employs two guys, Barry and Dick. He hired them at first for three days a week and they just started coming in every day!

questions.text: Whose song is Marie De Salle singing when Rob first hears her music?
questions.explanation:
Peter Frampton.

	The song is Peter Frampton's "Baby, I Love Your Way". Rob, transfixed, says to Dick and Barry "I always used to hate this song", they say "yeah". He then says "Now I kinda like it", they say "yeah".

questions.text: What is the fifth job on Rob's top five jobs?
questions.explanation:
Architect.

	Which Laura changes to "record store owner".

questions.text: Which character is played by Catherine Zeta-Jones?
questions.explanation:
Charlie.

	Rob's ex-girlfriend who left him for the dreaded Marco in college.

questions.text: What is the name of the band that Rob signs to his record label?
questions.explanation:
The Kinky Wizards.

	Earlier in the film they are caught shoplifting from Championship Vinyl!

questions.text: What is the name of Rob's record label?
questions.explanation:
Top Five Records.

	Just one of many top fives in this movie.

questions.text: What does Rob offer Barry NOT to play at the record release party?
questions.explanation:
10% of the gate.

	And when Barry turns it down, Rob offers him 20%, saying "That's how much it means to me NOT to hear you sing."

questions.correct: "Let's Get it On"  by Marvin Gaye
options: "Die, Mama, Die!"  by Sonic Death Monkey
questions.explanation:
"Let's Get it On"  by Marvin Gaye.

	And he pleasantly surprises Rob with a wonderful rendition of Marvin Gaye's classic. ("Sonic Death Monkey" is one of the names Barry's band were tossing about for their name, as well as "Kathleen Turner Overdrive", before ending up with "Barry Jive and the Uptown Five")
